content.description: This climb is located on the same rock as Jack Sparrow Crack, and is the obvious offwidth on the west face. Not an especially memorable climb, but somthing to do if in the area.
content.protection: #3 Camalot and larger (nothing smaller is needed)

content.description:
This route is located on a formation directly behind The Black Pearl. Head left from the base of Davy Jones Locker and tunnel through some boulders, where you will see a big buttress. The climb is on the south face and starts out of a chasm via stemming off of a boulder.

To descend, walk off the north side.

Overall its an ok climb, something else to do while in the area.
content.protection: gear from a .5 up to a 3 camalot.

climbs.name: Davey Jones's Locker
climbs.fa: Frasier Haney, Steven Powers, Todd Gordon

content.description: The climb starts off a ledge on the west face of the rock, goes straight up to the first bolt, then traverses right toward the arete clipping another bolt, then heads up again to the next bolt (this is the spicy part) clip two more bolts on the arete past easier climbing. The crux is one move, one very delicate move. Take care and have fun!
content.protection: Five bolts with a two bolt anchor at the top. Optional large piece for the first horizontal crack.
